resources.string: No sun rise on given date
No nautical dawn on given date
No nautical dusk on given date
No astrological dawn on given date
No astrological dusk on given date

string-array.name: dawnHelpAnswer
string-array.item: Dawn is the time before sunrise after which there is enough light for objects to be distinguishable, so that outdoor activities can commence.
In contrast, sunrise is the moment when the leading edge of the sun itself appears above the horizon.
Theoretically, it is the time at which the sun rises to 6° below the horizon.

string-array.name: duskHelpAnswer
string-array.item: Dusk is the time after sunset after which artificial illumination is required to read outside.
In contrast, sunset is the point at which the earth has rotated enough that the sun is no longer visible from the local horizon.
Theoretically, it is the time at which the sun sets to 6° below the horizon.

string-array.name: nauticalDawnHelpAnswer
string-array.item: Nautical dawn is the time before sunrise at which there is just enough sunlight for the horizon and some objects to be distinguishable.
Theoretically, it is the time at which the sun rises to 12° below the horizon.

string-array.name: nauticalDuskHelpAnswer
string-array.item: Nautical dusk is the time after sunrise till which there is enough sunlight for the horizon and some objects to be distinguishable.
Theoretically, it is the time at which the sun sets to 12° below the horizon.

string-array.name: astroDawnHelpAnswer
string-array.item: Astronomical dawn is the time before sunrise after which the sky is no longer complety dark.
Theoretically, it is the time at which the sun rises to 18° below the horizon.

string-array.name: astroDuskHelpAnswer
string-array.item: Astronomical dusk is the time after sunrise after which the sky is completely dark.
Theoretically, it is the time at which the sun sets to 18° below the horizon.
